The first Ecclesia on Narukami Island took place 1.5 months after Filon assumed control. The meeting was held on the newly built agora, and Filon presided over the proceedings.

As the citizens gathered, Filon stood before them, surveying the sea of faces. "Citizens of Narukami Island," he began, his voice strong and clear, "we are here today to discuss the future of our great community. We have many important issues to address, and I encourage open and respectful debate on all matters."

With that, Filon opened the floor to the first speaker, a young man named Marcos. Marcos took to the stage, his voice shaking with nervous energy. "Comrades," he began, "we must address the issue of food supplies. Our crops are failing, and the fish are scarce. We must find a solution, or we will face famine."

A chorus of shouts erupted from the crowd: "Sim! É verdade!" (Yes! It's true!)

Another speaker, a woman named Sofia, took the stage. "Comrades," she said, "we must address the issue of security. Bandits roam the countryside, and our people live in fear. We need a strong, organized police force to restore order."

More shouts of agreement echoed throughout the agora: "Sim! Temos que agir!" (Yes! We must act!)

And so it went, with each speaker bringing a new issue to the table: the need for trade with the other islands, the restoration of infrastructure, the development of new technologies. Each time, the citizens responded with shouts of agreement or disagreement, their voices filling the air.

Finally, it was time to vote. Filon called for a show of hands on each issue, and the citizens obliged. They raised their hands high, voting on each matter with a simple, yet powerful gesture. In the end, it was clear which issues were most important to the people, and which direction the community should move in.

The Ecclesia adjourned, with Filon promising to act on the results of the vote. The citizens dispersed, satisfied with the democratic process, and eager to see what the future held.
